body.p: includes a resizeable, floating popup window to help you find and replace content in the current document.
To open the Find/Replace popup window, click the Search button on the upper toolbar or use the keyboard shortcut.
The Find/Replace window includes the following:

dlentry.dd: This is where you will enter the text that you want to find. The number of results that are found in the current document are shown on the right side in this field and the results are highlighted in the editor. On Desktop versions, you can also use the Enter key on your keyboard to find the next occurrence.
You can enter text that you want to replace the text you entered in the Search for field. On Desktop versions, you can also use the Enter key on your keyboard to perform the replace operation.
If selected, the search operation will only find results if the exact letter case entered in the Search for field is found.
If selected, the search operation will only find results if the entire word or words entered in the Search for field are found.
Goes to the next occurrence of the result (on Desktop versions, you can also use the down arrow on your keyboard).
Goes to the previous occurrence of the result (on Desktop versions, you can also use the up arrow on your keyboard).
Use this button to perform the replace operation on the current result with the text specified in the Replace with field.
Use this button to perform the replace operation on all occurrences of the text specified in the Replace with field.

section.title: Other Notes About the Find/Replace Popup Window

ul.li: You can resize and drag the Find/Replace window and its last position will be remembered when you reopen it.
If you close the Find/Replace window and then reopen it without editing the document, your search result is preserved.
If you select content in the editor and then invoke the Find/Replace window, the Search for field will automatically be populated with the selected content.
The Match case and Whole words options are persistent in your current editing session so it remembers your selection from the last search.
The highlights for the results in the editor are persistent while the Find/Replace window is open. When you close the window, the highlights disappear.

section.title: Find/Replace in Text Mode
section.p: There is also a Find/Replace mechanism if you are editing in Text mode (Edit as XML from the More drop-down menu). To access the options, click the Search in the top-right corner of the editor and it will expand to reveal the options.
